title: morgan sans - searching similar fonts
content:
hi and hello,

for a logotype i am looking for fonts that look similar to  
these great fonts:

morgan sans (secretonix)  
mdd (playtypes/not possible to buy)  
beta sans (shiftype)

does anyone has ideas?

Thanks a lot  
jenz schoeniger
author: yenzen

comments.content: ..or maybe someone has any ideas about other, modern/technical looking fonts.. thanks jz
What do you find about those fonts that you do like, but somehow don’t want to use them? Is it cost?

Some maybe lesser known ’treasures’ _( Schaetzchen, halt.. :)_.:  
’ [Critter](http://web.archive.org/web/20091106134904/http:/www.letterror.com/catalog/critter/index.html)’, ’ [Dispose](http://web.archive.org/web/20091106134904/http:/www.identikalshop.com/font_ind.php?baseProductID=107)’, ’ [Downtempo](http://web.archive.org/web/20091106134904/http:/www.veer.com/partner/link.aspx?i=1129&p=products/typedetail.aspx?image=UMT0000022)’, ’ [Fishmonger](http://web.archive.org/web/20091106134904/http:/www.suitcasetype.com/page.php?lmut=en&section=font&font=fishmonger)’, ’ [Metsys](http://web.archive.org/web/20091106134904/http:/www.veer.com/partner/link.aspx?i=1129&p=products/typedetail.aspx?image=ALT0000116)’, ’ [Quagmire](http://web.archive.org/web/20091106134904/http:/www.veer.com/partner/link.aspx?i=1129&p=products/typedetail.aspx?image=DET0000201)’..

Dav, [formlos](http://web.archive.org/web/20091106134904/http:/www.formlos.net/)

Jens

You might find SOPHISTO useful for this project. Check out yourself at;  
 [http://www.macrhino.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20091106134904/http:/www.macrhino.com/ "http://www.macrhino.com")

Cheers
thanks, guys. i was drawing a blank today.

thanks to you all for your inspiration !  
sophisto and fismonger are my favorites.

miss tiffany: I have already used this fonts for other clients!

Greetings JENS

From [Psy/Ops](http://web.archive.org/web/20091106134904/http:/www.psyops.com/html/specimens.html) library (in addition to Sophisto):  
Faceplate Sans, Reform, Reykjavik One & Two, and Transfer Sans.

From [Process Type Foundry](http://web.archive.org/web/20091106134904/http:/www.processtypefoundry.com/typefaces/index.html):  
Klavika and Stratum

From [DSType](http://web.archive.org/web/20091106134904/http:/www.dstype.com/):  
Dione, Fragma, Plexes, Resea and Titan Text
